text: SYDNEY, March 12 Australia will introduce legislation in parliament to amend its offshore banking unit (OBU) rules to try to avoid the country being designated a harmful tax regime by the European Union and OECD, Treasurer Josh Frydenberg said on Friday.The OBU provides a more attractive tax rate for offshore banking activity conducted by Australian registered banks. (Reporting by Renju Jose; Editing by Jacqueline Wong)
